intro: Aporum tropidoneuron, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are adapted for pollination by insects. The rhizomes of Aporum tropidoneuron are edible and have been used traditionally for their starchy content.
